identifier.description: The publisher's identifier for the notice, which may not be unique

uid.description: An internal, constructed, unique identifier, which may be the same as `identifier`

date_published.description: The date of publication of the notice

summary.description: A brief summary of the notice's content

subjects.description: The entities that the notice is primarily about

related_entities.description: Other entities that the notice is about

activity_start_date.description: The date on which activity started

previous_owners.description: The previous owners of the locations

previous_operators.description: The previous operators of the locations

registration_date.description: The date on which the subjects are registered

activity_start_date.description: The date on which activity started

effective_date.description: The date from which the change is in effect

previous_owners.description: The previous owners of the locations

previous_operators.description: The previous operators of the locations

registration_date.description: The date on which the subjects are registered

activity_start_date.description: The date on which activity started

effective_date.description: The date from which the change is in effect

publication.description: Another publication in which the notice is published

date_published.description: The date of publication of the publication

previous_owners.description: The previous owners of the locations

previous_operators.description: The previous operators of the locations

activity_start_date.description: The date on which activity started

effective_date.description: The date from which the change is in effect

previous_operators.description: The previous operators of the location

activity_end_date.description: The date on which activity ended

closing_date.description: The closing date of the filing

update_action.description: If this notice corrects or cancels an earlier notice, a description of the update

issue.description: The issue of the gazette in which the notice is published. An issue contains many notices.

document.description: The section of the issue in which the notice is published. An issue may be split into many documents, each containing many notices.

creator.description: The entity authoring the notice, for example a notary authoring a notice for a dissolution

publisher.description: The publisher of the notice, for example a clerk entering the notice into the gazette

url.description: The URL of the notice, at which a human may verify the data

media_type.description: The media type of the URL resource

source_url.description: The URL of the file from which the data was extracted by the scraper

sample_date.description: A date on which the data is known to be true

retrieved_at.description: The time or date at which the source URL was requested

confidence.description: The scraper's author's confidence in the accuracy of the data

other_attributes.description: Any other structured data from the notice

publication.description: The gazette of which the issue is a part

edition_id.description: The identifier of the edition of which the issue is a part

page_range.description: The page range of the issue within the edition

media_type.description: The media type of the URL resource

jurisdiction_code.description: The jurisdiction covered by the gazette

media_type.description: The media type of the URL resource
The media type of the URL resource

page_range.description: The page range of the document within the issue

media_type.description: The media type of the URL resource

activity.description: The business activity at the location

origin.description: The origin of the location as an asset

media_type.description: The media type of the content

update_action.title: Update action
update_action.description: An act of changing an object

identifier.description: The publisher's identifier for the notice, which may not be unique

date_published.description: The date of publication of the notice

issue.description: The issue of the gazette in which the notice is published. An issue contains many notices.

edition_id.description: The identifier of the edition of which the issue is a part

company_number.description: unique identifier given by the corporate register with which it is incorporated

jurisdiction.description: A free text field for the jurisdiction where the company is registered – this can be either the ISO 3166-2 code, the underscored version, or the standard name for the jurisdiction, e.g. France

jurisdiction_code.description: Code representing the jurisdiction/company register which is the canonical record of the company’s existence. Uses underscored ISO 3166-2 to represent it, e.g. es for Spain, us_de for Delaware

branch.description: A flag to denote whether a company is a branch entity. This should only be set if the company is a type of branch (otherwise should be null). In general the only option here is 'F' for a 'Foreign' branch, i.e. an out-of-jurisdiction entity that has registered as having a presence in the jurisdiction. In the US this is sometimes called a Foreign Corporation

all_attributes.description: Other arbitrary attributes for a given company

jurisdiction_of_origin.description: The jurisdiction of the 'home' company if this is a branch

home_company_number.description: If the entity is a 'branch', this is the company_number of the 'home' company in the home company's jurisdiction

home_legal_name.description: The legal name of the 'home' company in its jurisdiction if this is a branch, and the name is different from the legal name of the branch

registered_agent_address.description: The address of the 'Agent', a public address to which legal papers can be served

registered_agent_name.description: The 'Agent' of the company – a person or entity that is empowered to accept service for the company

merged_into.description: Information on the merger of this company into a 'survivor' company

surviving_company.description: the surviving_company that this has been merged into

name.description: The legal name of the surviving company

company_number.description: The company_number of the surviving company, if known

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction of incorporation of the surviving company

officer.description: An officer (director, senior executive) of a company

uid.description: a unique identifier given to the officership

person_uid.description: a unique identifier given to the individual (as opposed to the officership)

type.description: The type of entity that is the officer (either 'Person' or 'Company')

share-parcel.description: A parcel of shares in a company

percentage_of_shares_min.description: Minimum percentage of shares (if for example a band of percentage is given)

percentage_of_shares_max.description: Maximum percentage of shares (if for example a band of percentage is given)

voting_percentage_min.description: Minimum percentage of votes (if for example a band of votes is given)

voting_percentage_max.description: Maximum percentage of votes (if for example a band of votes is given)

share_class.description: Share class or classes, if known

shareholders.description: Legal persons who own this share parcel

name.description: Name of natural person or company

company_number.description: Company number, if company and known

type.description: Type of person if known (company or natural person)

address_country.description: Country part of owner's address (for example if address not given)

total-shares.description: The total number of shares a company has issued

identifier.description: An identifier for an entity (possibly other things, e.g. securities in the future). Examples are tax IDs, non-profit IDs, SEC CIK numbers, Federal Reserve RSSD id. The main requirements for an identifier is that they should be well-defined, and issued by a government or have statutory standing

uid.description: The unique identifier given by the identifier system – it should be unique in the context of the identifier_system

identifier_system_code.description: An identifier representing the identifier scheme. Some examples of this are us_fein (US Federal tax number), us_sec_cik (US Securities and Exchange Commission CIK), uk_ew_cc (Charity Commission of England & Wales), lei (Global Legal Entity Identifier System)

industry-code.description: An industry code from a standard code list (e.g. NAICS 2007 or NACE 2). This schema is a sub-schema of Classification.

code_scheme_id.description: An identifier representing industry code scheme. At the moment these are eu_nace_2, uk_sic_2003, uk_sic_2007, us_naics_2002, us_naics_2007, be_nace_2008, dk_db_2007, nz_bic_2006, no_sic_2007, anz_sic_2006, nz_bic_2006, in_nic_2004_mca, ca_qc_cae, lu_nace_2. For other code schemes, or details of these, contact info@opencorporates.com

previous-name.name: PreviousName
previous-name.description: A previous name of a company

con_date.description: The end (conversion) date of the name

alternative-name.description: An alternative name of a company, e.g. abbreviation, trading (including dba or doing business as), legal. As well as trading names etc, it can be used for storing alternative language representations of the legal name, in which case the language should be represented as two-letter ISO-639 code

person.description: A person, for example, referenced in some other context, e.g. director of a company, shareholder, licence-holder, lobbyist. This should be used only if the person is the subject of the datum

jurisdiction.description: Name of the jurisdiction in which the entity is based

company.description: Company the person is representing. NB If the licence holder is a company, and the individual is a just a contact, then use the company-schema for the entity. This is where the individual themselves are the subject entity (e.g. licence holder, disqualified director)

uid.description: Unique id of the person. Note: the unique id is not expected to be globally unique, but only unique with reference to the source from which it is derived. No check is made for uniqueness

registered_address.description: address for service (or address given in the context of legal requirement)

country_of_residence.description: The normal country of residence for the person

other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

oneOf.description: The name of a person as an object

given_name.description: The given name(s) (often first name) of a person, as opposed to their family name. Following FOAF practice, this is preferred to first_name

family_name.description: The family name (often last name) of a person, as opposed to their family name. Following FOAF practice, this is preferred to last_name

title.description: Title such as Mr, Ms, Dr etc

suffixes.description: Any suffixes, including degrees, honours (OBE), ordinals (John Smith Jr, Bill Jones II) etc

date.description: A parsed date object. This allows us to represent not just normal dates, but also partial dates too

month.description: month part of date in numbers e.g. 11 for November, 4 for April

day.description: day part of date in numbers

organisation.description: An entity which is a distinct organisation, but is not a company nor an individual. Examples include governments and governmental entities (e.g. Multilateral Development Banks, Government Departments, municipalities, etc), and also membership organisations

jurisdiction.description: Name of the jurisdiction in which the entity is incorporated/domiciled (use global for global entities, e.g. UN)

legal_form.description: legal form of organisation, e.g. municipality, government department, trust, etc

other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

unknown-entity-type.description: An entity of unknown type - potentially a company, a person, government entity, or some unincorporated organisation

jurisdiction.description: Name of the jurisdiction in which the entity is incorporated/domiciled

uid.description: Unique id for the entity if it has one

other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: A classification from a code list

name.description: A title or description of the classification, especially if the value is a code
